title: How to Install Curl on Windows

steps.title: Go to https://curl.haxx.se/download.html in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://curl.haxx.se/download.html in a web browser. cURL is used in command lines or scripts to transfer data. For example curl https://www.wikihow.com will return the HTTP response.

steps.title: Click curl Download Wizard.
steps.content: Click curl Download Wizard . You'll see this under the "Download Wizard" header.

steps.title: Click curl executable.
steps.content: Click curl executable . This is usually the first listing in the menu.

steps.title: Click the drop-down under "Select Operating System" and select Windows 32 or 64.
steps.content: Click the drop-down under "Select Operating System" and select Windows 32 or 64. If your CPU is a 32-bit processor, you'll need to download the 32-bit version; if your CPU is a 64-bit processor, you can download either, but the 64-bit version of cURL will take full advantage of your CPU's benefits. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Select.
steps.content: Click Select . This is next to the drop-down menu of available OS-compatible downloads.

steps.title: Select what version you want (only available for certain downloads, like Win32).
steps.content: Select what version you want (only available for certain downloads, like Win32). Some builds of cURL, like with Win32, have different versions. Click the drop-down to select a version. If "Generic" is available, choose that. Click Select to continue. You'll be directed to a page of recommended downloads.

steps.title: Click the arrow in the first result.
steps.content: Click the arrow in the first result. This is usually a link to a download from the official cURL website.

steps.title: Click the build you want.
steps.content: Click the build you want. You may have to choose between a 32-bit and 64-bit build again.

steps.title: Save the downloaded file.
steps.content: Save the downloaded file. When your file browser pops up, choose a location to save the file and click Save .

steps.title: Extract the files from the zipped folder.
steps.content: Extract the files from the zipped folder. A zipped file will download to the location you specified, and you'll need to unzip the folder to continue. Right-click on the folder and select ' Extract All , then specify a location where you want to unzip the files to.

steps.title: Open the unzipped folder and files and find "curl.
steps.content: Open the unzipped folder and files and find "curl. exe . " . You'll find the root folder in the location you previously specified. And you'll probably find "curl.exe" in the bin folder.

steps.title: Type "cmd" in the address bar of your file browser to launch a command window.
steps.content: Type "cmd" in the address bar of your file browser to launch a command window. You can also type "CMD" in the search area of the Start Menu.

steps.title: Type "curl" into the command window and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type "curl" into the command window and press ↵ Enter . If you opened the command window from the address bar of file browser while you were navigated in the "bin" folder, command prompt should already have the appropriate address entered. You should see command prompt return to you commands that you can try with curl. [3] X Research source You can use the curl command on your computer from that specific path. If you type "curl" in command prompt at a path different from where it's located (in the "bin" folder of the unzipped folder), it will not work.
